comment: Never responds to emails. Gave us a week to work on an assignment, but didn't open it until Saturday! Lots of group work for an online class.

She was such a sweet professor and very understanding. I will say her accent is sometimes hard to understand. There were times where it felt like she didn't know what she was talking about and a lot of times students were confused. I didn't learn a lot from her like I wish I would have. The assignments were easy but beware of the disposition diary.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: She is okay. What bothered me the most is that she doesn't respond to her emails at all so if you need to talk to her via email, she won't respond. She is hard to reach but the best way to talk to her is before/after class on campus. Lots of work and she is a tough grader. Make sure you follow the rubric and do everything on time and in detailed.

Overall a good choice in a professor. I took her class online and she was always so caring and willing to help. Her lectures can be a bit lengthy and boring, but this class is an easy A as long as you do the work.

Very sweet professor. She can be a little hard to understand at times, but it's not hard to figure out where she's going. Fairly easy class,. The Disposition Diaries are a NIGHTMARE though. (Beware of that assignment with this class)

I took her online and she is very nice. She has an accent which sometimes makes it hard to understand but not really. She is so nice and so caring and her assignments are pretty easy. The language barrier can be tough for some but not a big deal for me

Dr. Shin was a nice person overall. She is hard to understand online because of her accent & technical issues. She is constantly changing her criteria for the assignments so at times this could make them very confusing. However, she is nice and at the end of the day if she's the only professor you can take, she isn't that bad!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: This is the most that I have ever struggled with a professor. She is incredibly hard to understand and every sentence includes the word um or uh. Directions are not clear at all and she does not provide feedback. No other ESOL class was doing the same thing as us, so I could not even look at other professors' instructions for assignments. Dont take
